input_sentence: The ego vehicle has to stop with respect to a stop sign (sign 206) before it enters the intersection at least for a duration of tslw in front of the associated stop line.
final_mtl_formula: G(at_traffic_sign(ego,sign_206) -> F_[0,T] (in_front_of(ego,stop_line) & in_standstill(ego) & G_[0,tslw] (in_front_of(ego,stop_line) & in_standstill(ego))) & ~(at_intersection(ego) U (in_front_of(ego,stop_line) & in_standstill(ego))))

atomic_propositions.description: Ego is in front of stop line

temporal_relations.description: When at stop sign and in front of stop line but not yet at intersection, ego must stop

metric_constraints.description: Ego must remain stopped for at least tslw duration

lexicon.before_stop_line: Ego is in front of stop line

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_sign_206 → sign_206
   - obj_stop_line → stop_line

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: at_intersection(ego)
   - ap_2: at_traffic_sign(ego,sign_206)
   - ap_3: in_standstill(ego)
   - ap_4: in_front_of(ego,stop_line)

3. Build antecedent from temporal relation: 
   - ap_2 & ap_4 & ~ap_1 → at_traffic_sign(ego,sign_206) & in_front_of(ego,stop_line) & ~at_intersection(ego)

4. Apply metric constraint: minimum duration [0,tslw] for ap_3 (in_standstill(ego)) → G_[0,tslw](in_standstill(ego))

5. Combine with global property "Always": G(antecedent → consequent with duration)

6. Final structure: G((at_traffic_sign(ego,sign_206) & in_front_of(ego,stop_line) & ~at_intersection(ego)) → G_[0,tslw](in_standstill(ego)))

Final MTL Formula:
G((at_traffic_sign(ego,sign_206) & in_front_of(ego,stop_line) & ~at_intersection(ego)) -> G_[0,tslw](in_standstill(ego)))

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula begins with a global operator `G`, indicating an "always" condition.
- Inside, there's an implication `->` with a conjunction of three conditions on the left:
  - `at_traffic_sign(ego,sign_206)` translates to "ego is at traffic sign 206" (preserving the specific sign identifier)
  - `in_front_of(ego,stop_line)` translates to "ego is in front of the stop line" (maintaining the spatial relationship)
  - `~at_intersection(ego)` translates to "ego is not at an intersection" (negation handled naturally)
- The right side of the implication contains `G_[0,tslw](in_standstill(ego))`, which means "ego must remain in standstill for the duration from 0 to tslw seconds" (interpreting the bounded global operator as a continuous duration requirement)
- The entire structure represents a conditional requirement that must hold at all times

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if ego is at traffic sign 206 and ego is in front of the stop line and ego is not at an intersection, then ego must remain in standstill for at least tslw duration.

atomic_propositions.description: Ego is in front of stop line

temporal_relations.description: After reaching stop sign, eventually stop in front of stop line

metric_constraints.description: Ego must remain stopped for at least tslw duration

lexicon.before_stop_line: Ego is in front of stop line

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_sign_206 → sign_206
   - obj_stop_line → stop_line
   - obj_intersection → intersection

2. Construct atomic propositions in predicate(object) format:
   - ap_1: at_intersection(ego)
   - ap_2: at_traffic_sign(ego,sign_206)
   - ap_3: in_standstill(ego)
   - ap_4: in_front_of(ego,stop_line)

3. Process temporal relations:
   - First relation: at_traffic_sign(ego,sign_206) → F_[0,T] (in_front_of(ego,stop_line) & in_standstill(ego))
   - Second relation: (in_standstill(ego) & in_front_of(ego,stop_line)) must occur before at_intersection(ego)
     This implies: (in_standstill(ego) & in_front_of(ego,stop_line)) U_[0,∞] ~at_intersection(ego)

4. Apply metric constraint:
   - Minimum duration [0,tslw] applies to in_standstill(ego)
   - This requires: G_[0,tslw] in_standstill(ego) starting from when stopping occurs

5. Combine with global property "Always":
   - Wrap entire formula with G operator
   - Ensure temporal ordering: stop sign → stop at line (with duration) → before intersection

6. Final structure:
   - When at traffic sign: eventually stop in front of stop line
   - While stopped: maintain standstill for tslw duration
   - All stopping must occur before entering intersection

Final MTL Formula:
G(at_traffic_sign(ego,sign_206) -> F_[0,T] (in_front_of(ego,stop_line) & in_standstill(ego) & G_[0,tslw] in_standstill(ego) & (in_standstill(ego) U_[0,∞] ~at_intersection(ego))))

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- First, I analyze the main structure: G(condition -> consequence), meaning "Always, if condition then consequence"
- Condition: at_traffic_sign(ego,sign_206) → "ego is at traffic sign 206"
- Consequence: F_[0,T] (multiple conditions)
- Multiple conditions inside F_[0,T]:
  - in_front_of(ego,stop_line) → "ego is in front of stop line"
  - in_standstill(ego) → "ego is in standstill"
  - G_[0,tslw] in_standstill(ego) → "ego remains in standstill for at least tslw duration"
  - (in_standstill(ego) U_[0,∞] ~at_intersection(ego)) → "ego remains in standstill until it is no longer at an intersection"
- The time bounds: F_[0,T] means "within T seconds", G_[0,tslw] means "for tslw seconds", U_[0,∞] means "until eventually"
- The predicates preserve object information: ego vehicle, traffic sign 206, stop line

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if ego is at traffic sign 206, then within T seconds:
- ego must be in front of the stop line and in standstill,
- must remain in standstill for at least tslw duration,
- and must remain in standstill until it is no longer at an intersection.

- must remain in standstill for at least tslw duration,
- and must remain in standstill until it is no longer at an intersection.

Reasoning Process:

   - obj_intersection → intersection

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for atomic propositions:

   - ap_3: in_standstill(ego)
   - ap_4: in_front_of(ego,stop_line)

3. Analyze temporal relations:

   - Second relation: ~(at_intersection(ego) U (in_front_of(ego,stop_line) & in_standstill(ego)))

4. Apply metric constraint:
   - When both in_front_of(ego,stop_line) and in_standstill(ego) hold, they must persist for duration [0,tslw]
   - Add G_[0,tslw] (in_front_of(ego,stop_line) & in_standstill(ego)) to the stopping condition

   - Ensure the stopping duration applies when the vehicle stops in front of the stop line
   - Maintain the safety constraint that intersection entry cannot occur before stopping

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- First, I identify the main structure: G(antecedent -> consequent)
- The antecedent is: at_traffic_sign(ego,sign_206) → "ego is at traffic sign 206"
- The consequent is a complex conjunction with three parts:
  1. F_[0,T] (in_front_of(ego,stop_line) & in_standstill(ego) & G_[0,tslw] (in_front_of(ego,stop_line) & in_standstill(ego)))
     - This means within T seconds, ego must be in front of stop line AND in standstill AND remain so for tslw duration
  2. ~(at_intersection(ego) U (in_front_of(ego,stop_line) & in_standstill(ego)))
     - This means ego cannot be at intersection until it reaches the position in front of stop line AND is in standstill
- I preserve all object information: "ego vehicle", "stop line", "traffic sign 206"
- The temporal bounds [0,T] and [0,tslw] are maintained as duration requirements
- The until operator U is translated as "until" with the negation creating a prohibition

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if the ego vehicle is at traffic sign 206, then:
1. Within T seconds, the ego vehicle must be in front of the stop line and in standstill, and must remain in front of the stop line and in standstill for at least tslw duration
2. The ego vehicle must not be at an intersection until it reaches the position in front of the stop line and is in standstill

2. The ego vehicle must not be at an intersection until it reaches the position in front of the stop line and is in standstill

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
